page.title: 07RIVERSIDE WALK AT HOARWITHY
page.content: There is a good network of public footpaths at Hoarwithy which are used by visitors and ramblers. Most paths are signposted, but many stiles need repairing. A pleasant two mile walk starts from the iron bridge at Hoarwithy. Cross the stile opposite the tall house and follow the signed path along the banks of the River Wye. At a small ruined shed turn left across an awkward hurdle onto the road, which you cross and immediately turn left up a steep winding lane to Altbough.At the next road junction turn right, and at the brow of the hill take the signed bridlepath on the left leading between hedges. After a narrow gate the path enters a field with good open views. Keep to the left hand side, then steeply descend the sunken track to the lane. Turn left past Tresseck Farm to Hoarwithy.
